values.title: Use debians in pipelines, and update to cxx17

values.description:
Depends on [ign-rendering pull request #97](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/97)

The threaded rendering setup is based on [this Qt example](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtquick-scenegraph-textureinthread-example.html). As for rendering, instead of creating Qt FBO objects and using them for rendering and display, we’re creating a Qt texture from Ogre’s OpenGL render texture and displaying that in QQuickItem.

This approach works for both ogre 1.9 and ogre 2.1 render engine in ign-rendering

To test, start `ign gui` and insert the `Scene3D` plugin
values.title: Ogre + QtQuick integration take 2

summary.raw:
Depends on [ign-rendering pull request #97](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/97)

The threaded rendering setup is based on [this Qt example](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qtquick-scenegraph-textureinthread-example.html). As for rendering, instead of creating Qt FBO objects and using them for rendering and display, we’re creating a Qt texture from Ogre’s OpenGL render texture and displaying that in QQuickItem.

This approach works for both ogre 1.9 and ogre 2.1 render engine in ign-rendering

To test, start `ign gui` and insert the `Scene3D` plugin
summary.html:
Depends on ign-rendering pull request #97

The threaded rendering setup is based on this Qt example. As for rendering, instead of creating Qt FBO objects and using them for rendering and display, we’re creating a Qt texture from Ogre’s OpenGL render texture and displaying that in QQuickItem.

This approach works for both ogre 1.9 and ogre 2.1 render engine in ign-rendering

To test, start ign gui and insert the Scene3D plugin

values.description: The Scene3D will now make a service call to get the initial scene data using ign-transport service requests. The service name can be specified through the `<service>` param
values.title: Add Scene requestor class for populating Scene3D

summary.raw: The Scene3D will now make a service call to get the initial scene data using ign-transport service requests. The service name can be specified through the `<service>` param
summary.html: The Scene3D will now make a service call to get the initial scene data using ign-transport service requests. The service name can be specified through the <service> param

values.description:
Restore ability to control camera view based on input mouse events

Note that the right mouse press event is now intercepted by this plugin for zooming the camera, which prevents the item’s context menu from showing up \(e.g. to access it’s settings\). We could decide to sacrifice the right mouse zoom functionality in favor of the context pop-up menu.
values.title: Restore Scene3D camera view control

summary.raw:
Restore ability to control camera view based on input mouse events

Note that the right mouse press event is now intercepted by this plugin for zooming the camera, which prevents the item’s context menu from showing up \(e.g. to access it’s settings\). We could decide to sacrifice the right mouse zoom functionality in favor of the context pop-up menu.
summary.html:
Restore ability to control camera view based on input mouse events

Note that the right mouse press event is now intercepted by this plugin for zooming the camera, which prevents the item’s context menu from showing up (e.g. to access it’s settings). We could decide to sacrifice the right mouse zoom functionality in favor of the context pop-up menu.

values.description:
This PR lets user specify a `<pose_topic>` for the Scene3D plugin to subscribe to, and the received msgs will be used to update the pose of visuals in the scene.

Also pimpl'ized IgnRenderer class and renamed `SceneRequester` to `SceneManager` class
values.title: Scene3d plugin: Subscribe to pose topic

summary.raw:
This PR lets user specify a `<pose_topic>` for the Scene3D plugin to subscribe to, and the received msgs will be used to update the pose of visuals in the scene.

Also pimpl'ized IgnRenderer class and renamed `SceneRequester` to `SceneManager` class
summary.html:
This PR lets user specify a <pose_topic> for the Scene3D plugin to subscribe to, and the received msgs will be used to update the pose of visuals in the scene.

Also pimpl'ized IgnRenderer class and renamed SceneRequester to SceneManager class

values.description: We have to set all protobuf fields, otherwise they are set to default values. In this case, if the GUI is paused and the step button is pressed then the outbound message would contain pause == false. Simulation would then play on step.
values.title: send pause state in proto messages

summary.raw: We have to set all protobuf fields, otherwise they are set to default values. In this case, if the GUI is paused and the step button is pressed then the outbound message would contain pause == false. Simulation would then play on step.
summary.html: We have to set all protobuf fields, otherwise they are set to default values. In this case, if the GUI is paused and the step button is pressed then the outbound message would contain pause == false. Simulation would then play on step.

values.description:
This allows embedding plugin configs into [<world><gui>](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=world#world_gui). If attributes are used, SDF strips them out.

To be used by [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/51/move-gui-plugins-to-sdf-file) ign-gazebo PR.
values.title: [gz11] Use XML elements instead of attributes to fit SDF spec

This allows embedding plugin configs into [<world><gui>](http://sdformat.org/spec?ver=1.6&elem=world#world_gui). If attributes are used, SDF strips them out.

To be used by [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/51/move-gui-plugins-to-sdf-file) ign-gazebo PR.

This allows embedding plugin configs into <world><gui>. If attributes are used, SDF strips them out.

values.description:
Builds on top of pull request #163.

Expose anchor properties to the XML so plugins can be moved as the window is resized. For example, on [this](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/51/move-gui-plugins-to-sdf-file/diff) ign-gazebo PR:

![anchor.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2280927924-anchor.gif)

There are times when the `Scene3D` doesn't expand all the way and leaves a white space behind, I think there may be a timing issue with the logic of that plugin. Other plugins are following nicely.
values.title: [gz11] Anchor to window via XML

Builds on top of pull request #163.

![anchor.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2280927924-anchor.gif)

There are times when the `Scene3D` doesn't expand all the way and leaves a white space behind, I think there may be a timing issue with the logic of that plugin. Other plugins are following nicely.
summary.html:
Builds on top of pull request #163.

Expose anchor properties to the XML so plugins can be moved as the window is resized. For example, on this ign-gazebo PR:

There are times when the Scene3D doesn't expand all the way and leaves a white space behind, I think there may be a timing issue with the logic of that plugin. Other plugins are following nicely.

values.description:
Allow plugins to anchor to other previously loaded plugins, instead of only to the window.

Although QML supports having different anchors to different targets, I chose to support all anchors sharing the same target so it's easier to manage on our side. Please comment below if you'd like more details, but it's basically related to keeping track of plugin's parents.

The `scene3d.config` example has been changed so that the control and stats plugins are anchored to the scene, not to the window. This doesn't make a visual difference right now, but it will once we have multiple docked plugins next to the scene.

This is part of branch `gz11_split`, which I'm breaking into smaller changes while I implement the remaining features.
values.title: [gz11] Extend anchor logic so plugins can anchor to each other

summary.raw:
Allow plugins to anchor to other previously loaded plugins, instead of only to the window.

Although QML supports having different anchors to different targets, I chose to support all anchors sharing the same target so it's easier to manage on our side. Please comment below if you'd like more details, but it's basically related to keeping track of plugin's parents.

The `scene3d.config` example has been changed so that the control and stats plugins are anchored to the scene, not to the window. This doesn't make a visual difference right now, but it will once we have multiple docked plugins next to the scene.

This is part of branch `gz11_split`, which I'm breaking into smaller changes while I implement the remaining features.
summary.html:
Allow plugins to anchor to other previously loaded plugins, instead of only to the window.

Although QML supports having different anchors to different targets, I chose to support all anchors sharing the same target so it's easier to manage on our side. Please comment below if you'd like more details, but it's basically related to keeping track of plugin's parents.

The scene3d.config example has been changed so that the control and stats plugins are anchored to the scene, not to the window. This doesn't make a visual difference right now, but it will once we have multiple docked plugins next to the scene.

This is part of branch gz11_split, which I'm breaking into smaller changes while I implement the remaining features.

values.description:
This is being broken into several pull requests:

* ~~pull request #167~~
* ~~pull request #168~~

---

### Current features

* Each plugin can either be `floating` or `docked`
    * `floating`: can be freely moved, resized and positioned on the screen above all others
    * `docked`: embedded into the window layout and 
* It is possible to transition from `floating` to `docked` and vice-cersa
* `floating` plugins' positions can be:
    * absolute within the window
    * anchored to the window or to another plugin (currently only settable from XML)
* The docks respect the plugin's `Layout.minimum[Width/Height]` settings
* As plugins are inserted, they're automatically docked

![docking_opt.gif](data/bitbucket.org/repo/64K5zaR/images/2290434147-docking_opt.gif)


---

### TODO

* Remove jump when hiding toolbar on floating state
* Save / reload split sizes
* Support setting floating plugin's background color
* Support dock repositioning
* Support other layouts (currently hardcoded to 1 horizontal split -> multiple vertical splits)
* Close anchored plugins when target anchor plugin is closed
values.title: Better layouting

---

### Current features

* Each plugin can either be `floating` or `docked`
    * `floating`: can be freely moved, resized and positioned on the screen above all others
    * `docked`: embedded into the window layout and

summary.html:
This is being broken into several pull requests:

  • pull request #167
  • pull request #168

Current features

  • Each plugin can either be floating or docked
    • floating: can be freely moved, resized and positioned on the screen above all others
    • docked: embedded into the window layout and
  • It is possible to transition from floating to docked and vice-cersa
  • floating plugins' positions can be:
    • absolute within the window
    • anchored to the window or to another plugin (currently only settable from XML)
  • The docks respect the plugin's Layout.minimum[Width/Height] settings
  • As plugins are inserted, they're automatically docked

TODO

  • Remove jump when hiding toolbar on floating state
  • Save / reload split sizes
  • Support setting floating plugin's background color
  • Support dock repositioning
  • Support other layouts (currently hardcoded to 1 horizontal split -> multiple vertical splits)
  • Close anchored plugins when target anchor plugin is closed

values.description:
This adds support for planes. In addition to creating the plane in the scene, this pull request adds a way to account for the normal vector in the specification of a plane geometry. This is done by storing a local rotation between the `Visual` and the plane when the plane geometry is initialized. 

Note that the normal vector is expressed in the frame of it's parent.
values.title: Add support for planes

summary.raw:
This adds support for planes. In addition to creating the plane in the scene, this pull request adds a way to account for the normal vector in the specification of a plane geometry. This is done by storing a local rotation between the `Visual` and the plane when the plane geometry is initialized. 

Note that the normal vector is expressed in the frame of it's parent.
summary.html:
This adds support for planes. In addition to creating the plane in the scene, this pull request adds a way to account for the normal vector in the specification of a plane geometry. This is done by storing a local rotation between the Visual and the plane when the plane geometry is initialized.

Note that the normal vector is expressed in the frame of it's parent.

values.description: The [ignition-gui1 homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/Formula/ignition-gui1.rb#L65-L74) has a test that compiles example code against this library using flags from pkg-config. The test failed during the [most recent bottle build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/64/label=osx_highsierra/console) when it could not find the Qt5 header files. This PR ensures that the Qt components are included in the pkg-config requirements.
values.title: use ign_find_package for Qt5 and specify PKGCONFIG fields

summary.raw: The [ignition-gui1 homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/Formula/ignition-gui1.rb#L65-L74) has a test that compiles example code against this library using flags from pkg-config. The test failed during the [most recent bottle build](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/64/label=osx_highsierra/console) when it could not find the Qt5 header files. This PR ensures that the Qt components are included in the pkg-config requirements.
summary.html: The ignition-gui1 homebrew formula has a test that compiles example code against this library using flags from pkg-config. The test failed during the most recent bottle build when it could not find the Qt5 header files. This PR ensures that the Qt components are included in the pkg-config requirements.

values.description:
Some of them:

* Do not use std::toupper
* Use LoadLib instead of LoadLibrary to make Windows happy

    * See [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/21](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/21)
    
* Add aliases for popen/pclose
* Missing libraries to link
* Do not use PrintWindowsSystemWarning since it is not expored in common

The whole family of fixes is being tested here:

* [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign\_gui-pr-win/12/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_gui-pr-win/12/console)

~~There are still some linking failures that are probably trivial under the somebody else eyes but gave some headaches on Friday:~~  Yes, they were trivial: [244b0d5](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/commits/244b0d5e17bc0d74e34e730c53039693919ba034)
values.title: Fix for ign-gui1 windows compilation

Some of them:

* Do not use std::toupper
* Use LoadLib instead of LoadLibrary to make Windows happy

    * See [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/21](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/21)
    
* Add aliases for popen/pclose
* Missing libraries to link

The whole family of fixes is being tested here:

summary.html:
Some of them:

  • Do not use std::toupper

  • Use LoadLib instead of LoadLibrary to make Windows happy

    • See #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/pull-requests/21

  • Add aliases for popen/pclose

  • Missing libraries to link
  • Do not use PrintWindowsSystemWarning since it is not expored in common

The whole family of fixes is being tested here:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/ign_gui-pr-win/12/console

There are still some linking failures that are probably trivial under the somebody else eyes but gave some headaches on Friday: Yes, they were trivial: 244b0d5

values.description:
This adds preliminary functionality for adding and removing entities from the scene.

* Adding is done by subscribing to a scene message that contains the added entities.
* Deleting is done by subscribing to a request message with a `delete_entity` request

### TODOs

* ~~Add a service for deleting entities instead of using pub/sub~~
values.title: [gz11]Support for Levels: Add and remove entities

summary.raw:
This adds preliminary functionality for adding and removing entities from the scene.

* Adding is done by subscribing to a scene message that contains the added entities.
* Deleting is done by subscribing to a request message with a `delete_entity` request

### TODOs

* ~~Add a service for deleting entities instead of using pub/sub~~
summary.html:
This adds preliminary functionality for adding and removing entities from the scene.

  • Adding is done by subscribing to a scene message that contains the added entities.
  • Deleting is done by subscribing to a request message with a delete_entity request

TODOs

  • Add a service for deleting entities instead of using pub/sub

Using this ign-gazebo PR, and populating the backend scene with some placeholder objects.

TODO

  • It currently crashes if 2 ImageDisplay plugins are loaded at the same time, this needs to be fixed Done

values.description:
Some portability fixes. Special attention to the ones done in the plugins. They can not use the usual `IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE` since they are linking against the main gui library \(at that point we want `IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE` set to import and plugins need it set to export\). I’m using custom code in every header \(this can be generalized later\).

These changes leaves the first sucessful compilation of ignition-gui:

* ![](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_gui-pr-win&build=27)

    [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign\_gui-pr-win/27/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/27/))



Note: needs a small hack in ign-cmake: [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/125/hack-not-to-modify-absolute-path-libraries/diff](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/125/hack-not-to-modify-absolute-path-libraries/diff)
values.title: gz11 branch fixes to compile on Windows

Some portability fixes. Special attention to the ones done in the plugins. They can not use the usual `IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE` since they are linking against the main gui library \(at that point we want `IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE` set to import and plugins need it set to export\). I’m using custom code in every header \(this can be generalized later\).

These changes leaves the first sucessful compilation of ignition-gui:

summary.html:
Some portability fixes. Special attention to the ones done in the plugins. They can not use the usual IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE since they are linking against the main gui library (at that point we want IGNITION_GUI_VISIBLE set to import and plugins need it set to export). I’m using custom code in every header (this can be generalized later).

These changes leaves the first sucessful compilation of ignition-gui:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/27/)

Note: needs a small hack in ign-cmake: #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-cmake/pull-requests/125/hack-not-to-modify-absolute-path-libraries/diff

values.description:
Without this fix, some tests like `WorldControl_TEST` were failing with:

`[GUI] [Err] [Application.cc:361] Failed to load plugin [WorldControl] : couldn't get interface ignition::rendering::v1::OgreRenderEnginePlugin].`

Because they were trying to load the first plugin, which happened to be an ign-rendering one.
values.title: Get ign-gui plugin interface in case there are others

Because they were trying to load the first plugin, which happened to be an ign-rendering one.

[GUI] [Err] [Application.cc:361] Failed to load plugin [WorldControl] : couldn't get interface ignition::rendering::v1::OgreRenderEnginePlugin].
